sort_stream.gif

Yes!! I love the ability to drag the window in order to make it larger or smaller. Fantastic!

Now if only we could do that with the streams window, that would be tremendous!

DragTheStreamsWindow.jpg

In any case @Nikhil Kumar Mishra I believe that what you are showing is a good step forward! :thumbs_up: :thumbs_up:
@Nikhil Kumar Mishra that looks pretty reasonable; I think we could consider making it a bit smaller by replacing "sort" with an icon.

Thanks, @David Martin
I think the reason behind not making the "STREAMS" section stretchable was to kind of make things a bit standardized. I checked out other platforms like slack and Discord and they also have these sections of fixed width. What shall we do in our case?

@Nikhil Kumar Mishra This is a fundamental point to me.

I have hired and work with a number of UX/UI design and I and my UX/UI associates believe that systems which don't have the ability to expand this area simply have bad UX/UI design.

Regarding standardisation, consider this: Every OS (Mac, Linux and Windows) have the ability within their file explorers to easily increase or decrease the size of fields. (Think of Finder, Windows Explorer, etc). Imagine if they didn't! Imagine if you had a file called: "Zulip documentation 13-04-18.odt" and you could only see: "Z....04-18" as the entire filename. That's what it can feel like with streams!

@Nikhil Kumar Mishra Another HUGE point: Even without the ability to manually expand, Zulip is already AUTOMATICALLY expanding the size when you make your browser or Zulip Desktop software larger or smaller!

It just happens to be doing so in the least optimal way! See for yourself:

Zulip_MassiveWaistedSpace.png
And to think the authors of Windows Explorer pulled this all off without CSS “helping” them. ;)

@Nikhil Kumar Mishra From that perspective, perhaps you shouldn't worry yet about adding a manual method of dragging this space wider just yet.

To start with, perhaps we should just focus on enabling Zulip to use the space that it already creates in a more optimal way.
It’s been a steady climb downhill since Norton Commander. I am only partly joking.
@Steve Howell ... or Midnight Commander?
I don’t remember that one. But probably.
@Steve Howell Well you're right, it came later. Ah, MS-DOS.
Developing apps for Windows was fun and easy. Distributing software was a pain but the UI paradigms were halfway sensible and even elegant in their best moments.

sorting.gif
sort_menu.png
@Tim Abbott kindly have a look.
you could use "ABC" or "abc" to indicate the default sort.
I would also s/Weekly messages/Weekly traffic
we could also make the icons on each row click targets for the appropriate sort

Or have a second line below the Filter streams box maybe with "Sort by: abc :no_mouth: :bar_chart:". That would also easily allow flipping the sort to be ascending/descending by clicking on the icon twice.

Hmmm, you mean I shall replace the drop-down with two buttons below Filter Streams, something like
Sort by: [icon of subscriber Count] [icon of weekly traffic]
and allowing both ascending and descending order sorting, right?

and a third icon for "abc" (alphabetical sort).
I would display the ascending and descinding sort by :arrow_down: or :arrow_up: next to the icon that's being sorted, if that makes sense? And clicking again toggles the arrow and the sort.

Hmm, that will be completely changing the way it is being done right now, but yes It makes more sense. Okay, I will get back with something similar to what you are suggesting and then we can decide how we want it to be done.
we can wait for input from Tim, if this would be a lot of work to implement.
@Tim Abbott share your views about the same whenever you get time.

I'm not sure I understand what the "two buttons below filter streams" concept would look like -- is the idea that these buttons would appear when you click something, or always be visible? I'm a bit worried about making that left pane look cluttered in the default view, but I'd be on board with something where clicking something pops out another heading row.

The idea was they would be always there. I'm fine with something less visible, including the current suggestion from Nikhil.
In that case, I would:

  • Expand it to 6 menu items: i.e. the ascending and descending versions of the 3 sorts
  • Remove the first "Sort by" menu item.
  • Use a checkmark in the dropdown to indicate the current sort

Maybe call the three sorts:

  • Stream name
  • Subscriber count
  • Weekly traffic
    ?

Hmm, I like what you are suggesting, but the only problem with this is that we will have to have two options to sort in ascending and descending order. It won't look nice IMO. Clicking again on the same sorting option should sort ascending and descending alternatively. Let me try something to have this behavior in the menu list.
Yes, having two/three buttons which are always present will make that space look cluttered.
